Annotation.String: A hierarchical namespace of files.
This resource shall be used to represent a hierarchical namespace of files.
An instance of a hierarchical namespace of files.
This resource shall be used to represent an instance of a hierarchical namespace of files.
Block size of the file system in bytes.
The value of this property shall be the block size of the file system in bytes.
Capacity allocated to the file system.
The value of this property shall be the capacity allocated to the file system in bytes.
Remaining capacity allocated to the file system.
The value of this property shall be the remaining capacity allocated to the file system in bytes.
An array of capacity sources for the file system.
This property shall be an array containing entries for all the capacity sources for the file system. Each entry shall provide capacity allocation information from a named resource.
An array of low space warning threshold percentages for the file system.

This property shall be an array containing entries for the percentages of file system capacity at which low space warning events are be issued. A LOW_SPACE_THRESHOLD_WARNING event shall be triggered each time the remaining file system capacity value becomes less than one of the values in the array. The following shall be true: Across all CapacitySources entries, percent = (SUM(AllocatedBytes) - SUM(ConsumedBytes))/SUM(AllocatedBytes)
An array of supported IO access capabilities.
This property shall be an array containing entries for the supported IO access capabilities. Each entry shall specify a current storage access capability.
Case sensitive file names are supported by the file system.
This property shall indicate that case sensitive file names are supported by the file system. A value of True shall indicate that file names are case sensitive.
The case of file names is preserved by the file system.
This property shall indicate that the case of file names is preserved by the file system. A value of True shall indicate that case of file names shall be preserved.
An array of the character sets or encodings supported by the file system.
This property shall be an array containing entries for the character sets or encodings supported by the file system. Each entry shall specify a character set encoding supported by the file system.
A value indicating the maximum length of a file name within the file system.
If specified, this value shall specify the maximum length of a file name within the file system.
A value indicating the minimum file allocation size imposed by the file system.

This value shall specify the minimum file allocation size imposed by the file system. This minimum allocation size shall be the smallest amount of storage allocated to a file by the file system. Under stress conditions, the file system may allocate storage in amounts smaller than this value.
This value describes the replica attributes if this file system is a replica.

If this file system is a replica, this value shall describe its replication attributes. This value shall not be present if this file system is not a replica. A file system may be both a source and a replica.
An array of exported file shares of this file system.
This property shall be an array of exported file shares of this file system. Each entry shall define an exported file share of this file system.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to other resources that are related to this resource.
An array of links to replicas for this file system.
This property shall be an array of links to replicas for this file system. Each entry shall be a link to a replica for this file system.
The ClassOfService of this file system.
This value shall be a link to the ClassOfService for this file system.
Supported character code standards for different alphabets and languages.
The values shall indicate the character code standards supported by the file system.
ASCII character encoding.
This value shall indicate that the ASCII character encoding is supported by the file system.
Unicode character encoding.
This value shall indicate that Unicode characer encoding is supported by the file system.
ISO-2022 character encoding.
This value shall indicate that ISO-2022 character encoding is supported by the file system.
ISO-8859-1 character encoding.
This value shall indicate that ISO-8859-1 character encoding is supported by the file system.
Extended Unix Code encoding.
This value shall indicate that Extended Unix Code character encoding is supported by the file system.
UTF-8 character encoding.
This value shall indicate that the UTF-8 character encoding is supported by the file system.
UTF-16 character encoding.
This value shall indicate that the UTF-16 character encoding is supported by the file system.
UCS-2 character encoding.
This value shall indicate that the UCS-2 character encoding is supported by the file system.
The persistence characteristics of the file system.
The value shall indicate the persistence characteristics of the file system.
The file system is persistent, and will be preserved through an orderly shutdown.
This value shall indicate that the file system is persistent, and shall be preserved through an orderly shutdown.
The file system is not persistent, and may not survive a shutdown.
This value shall indicate that the file system is non-persistent and may not survive a shutdown.
The persistence type is known, but not defined by this standard. Use of this value is not recommended.
This value shall indicate that the persistence type is known, but not defined by this standard. Use of this value is not recommended.
The file sharing protocols supported by the file system.
The values shall indicate the file sharing protocols supported by the file system. At least one value shall be present.
NFSv3, as defined in RFC 1813.
This value shall indicate that NFSv3, as defined in RFC 1813, is supported by the file system.
NFSv4, as defined in RFC 7530.
This value shall indicate that NFSv4, as defined in RFC 7530, is supported by the file system.
NFSv4.1, as defined in RFC 5661.
This value shall indicate that NFSv4.1, as defined in RFC 5661, is supported by the file system.
Server Message Block version 2.0.
This value shall indicate that Server Message Block version 2.0 is supported by the file system.
Server Message Block version 2.1.
This value shall indicate that Server Message Block version 2.1 is supported by the file system.
Server Message Block version 3.0.
This value shall indicate that Server Message Block version 3.0 is supported by the file system.
Server Message Block version 3.0.2.
This value shall indicate that Server Message Block version 3.0.2 is supported by the file system.
Server Message Block version 3.1.1.
This value shall indicate that Server Message Block version 3.1.1 is supported by the file system.
